plugins.name: Filler
plugins.description:
A simple data safe lorem ipsum generator, that let's you be specific about the type and length of content to add.


How to use


Launch the plugin with the full ui, or keep it as a quick action from the command panel, either way goes. Enter the amount of sentences words or paragraphs to insert and hit enter!


From yours truly,

Ryan Nono
plugins.tagline: A data safe lorem ipsum generator that works with tabbing and arrow keys for boosted productivity

plugins.name: Gulugulu Effect - create Glass Effects in one click
plugins.description: Inspired by iOS 26 and modern glassmorphism trends, Gulugulu Effect lets you instantly apply a frosted glass look to any layer in Figma. It uses background blur, semi-transparent fills, and soft gradient strokes to recreate that polished, liquid-glass UI feel. No need to tweak settings manually. Just select, click, and vibe. Perfect for designers who want sleek, minimal, futuristic interfaces — fast.
plugins.tagline: Turn any shape into pure iOS-style liquid glass — in one click.

plugins.name: CSS Viewer
plugins.description:
The CSS Viewer plugin for Figma helps designers and developers streamline their workflow by displaying the CSS properties and corresponding Tailwind CSS classes of any selected design element. Whether you're working with raw CSS or using Tailwind in your development stack, this plugin bridges the gap between design and code.


🔍 Instantly view CSS properties (e.g., width, height, color, font, margin, padding, etc.) for selected layers.


🎨 Get the Tailwind CSS class equivalents for each style, making handoff to developers smoother and faster.
plugins.tagline: View any css property by using this plugin

135357.name: CSS Viewer
135357.description:

Whether you're working with raw CSS or using Tailwind in your development stack, this plugin bridges the gap between design and code.


🔍 Instantly view CSS properties (e.g., width, height, color, font, margin, padding, etc.) for selected layers.

135357.tagline: View any css property by using this plugin

plugins.name: Legoify
plugins.description:
Turn any image or frame into stunning BLOCK-style artwork with just one click. Legoify automatically generates a perfect grid of glassmorphic BLOCK bricks that overlay your design, creating that iconic brick aesthetic instantly. Perfect for mockups, presentations, or adding a playful dimension to your projects. Unleash your inner brick artist without the tedious manual work.


Features:


  1. One-click LEGO transformation
  2. Auto-adapts to any image size
  3. Realistic brick detail with studs
  4. Glassmorphic effect for modern appeal
  5. Non-destructive editing (original preserved)


From photos to UI designs—if you can select it, you can Legoify it!
plugins.tagline: One click brick or block effect generator

plugins.name: Lokki - Comments Export
plugins.description:
Description

A plugin that allows you to turn Figma comments into Jira tasks with a couple of clicks.


Key features

- Export comments to selected Jira project

- Filter comments

- Merge multiple comments into one.

- Turn comment into sub-issue of the existing Jira issue.


How to use

When you run the plugin, it offers a simple 3 step onboarding screen explaining how things work.

  1. During the first run, we'll ask you to connect your plugin with your Jira.
  2. Next you need to generate personal token that allows you access your comments. This is mandatory for plugins operation since Figma do not provide direct access to comments with figma plugin tools.
  3. Select Jira project that you will use as default. You can change it later.
  4. That's it. You can select comments and export them to the Jira.


Sidenote

This is our first-ever plugin on Figma, and while things might not be ideal all at once, we are happy to hear your feedback, questions, and suggestions at dev@lokki.tools

Webpage: https://lokki.tools


Data Security & Network access

Our plugin does not save any remote counterpart, it means your data is only stored on your computer, inside your Figma editor. This applies to all of your data, tokes and comments except user identifier related to the premium status and subscription info.


About

- Idea by Kseniia Pashkovska & Oleksandr Drobinin

- Implementation by Oleksandr Drobinin
plugins.tagline: Turn Figma comments into Jira tasks instantly

plugins.name: Fieldnotes
plugins.description:
Fieldnotes transforms in-person workshop sticky notes into digital boards.


Simply take photos of your sticky notes using your phone (you just have to scan a QR code to sync) or upload images directly to the plugin. Your physical sticky notes are instantly recreated in your board, preserving the texts, colors, position, and all your ideas :)


Fieldnotes combines several AI recognition technologies to boost accuracy and to detect even messy handwriting across multiple languages.

Pro users gain access to powerful AI-enhanced features including text improvement, grammar correction, and automatic workshop summaries.


Transform raw workshop notes into polished, actionable content and generate comprehensive takeaways to share with stakeholders, a dream follow-up!


If you want to learn more about the plugin or simply because you are passionate about Product or collaboration, feel free to reach out
plugins.tagline: Fieldnotes transforms pictures of sticky notes into stickies — ready to share, without the hassle

plugins.name: Easy Task Prioritiser
plugins.description:
Easy Task Prioritiser Quickly organize and rank your tasks using two proven prioritization frameworks — right inside Figma.


✨ How It Works

🔢 Stack Ranking

Go to the Stack tab.

Enter your list of tasks.

Click Start Comparison to begin.

You’ll be shown two tasks at a time — choose which is more important.

Repeat until all tasks are compared and ranked.

In the end:

You'll get a clear, ranked list of tasks

You can Copy to Clipboard or Push to Canvas to bring the list into your Figma file


🧠 MoSCoW Prioritization

Switch to the MoSCoW tab.

Add your tasks.

For each task, select whether it’s a Must, Should, Could, or Won’t.

Once done, use Push to Canvas to generate a structured visual layout by category.

In the end:

You can Copy to Clipboard or Push to Canvas to see tasks grouped by priority


This plugin is perfect for product teams, designers, and facilitators who want to make prioritization decisions quickly — and stay focused on what matters most.
plugins.tagline: Turn messy task lists into clear priorities.

plugins.name: Simple inspector
plugins.description:
CSS Extractor is a Figma plugin designed to help developers quickly extract CSS styles from selected elements and their children. It supports nested structures, text styles, image fills, and allows for easy image export. The UI provides options to copy the entire style block or individual style lines.


Key Features:


🔍 Display of selected elements and their child hierarchy.


🎨 Conversion of styles to CSS with unit selection: px or rem.


📋 Copy full CSS blocks or individual lines.


🖼 Export image fills directly from elements.
plugins.tagline: Simple inspector css style copy and export source image

plugins.name: ProdMax
plugins.description:
Prodmax - 10X Your Ideas into Software Execllence


ProdMax is an innovative intelligent frontend development platform that seamlessly integrates with both Web interfaces and Figma plugins to transform design mockups into high-quality frontend code. The platform aims to significantly enhance development efficiency, foster team collaboration, and streamline the design-to-development workflow.


Use Case:


Step 1. User Authentication

  1. Users complete secure authentication through the account-password login system to access the platform workspace

Step 2. Intelligent Component Creation

  1. Select target layers in the Figma interface
  2. Click the "New Biz Component" button to initiate component creation
  3. Add professional naming and functional descriptions for the component
  4. View corresponding DSL node structures in the component details page
  5. Support editing or deleting created components as needed

Step 3. Intelligent Page Construction

  1. Select page-level layers in Figma
  2. Click the "New Page" button to initiate page creation
  3. Add semantic naming and functional descriptions for the page
  4. View complete DSL node structures in the page details interface
  5. Support editing or deleting created pages as needed
plugins.tagline: 10X Your Ideas into Software Execllence

plugins.name: Prism by lumos
plugins.description:
🌈 Prism by Lumos


A smarter way to manage your Figma color variables


Prism is a powerful, easy-to-use plugin built to help you create, organize, and maintain a clean, scalable color system in Figma. Whether you’re building from scratch or refining an existing system, Prism takes the heavy lifting out of color management.


It’s the same powerful tool we use to power the Lumos Design System — with token-based color management built right in.


⸻


✨ What Prism does best

•🎨 Full Color System

Instantly generate a complete color palette (from 50 to 900) based on your base colors.

•🔗 Semantic Color Mapping

Create semantic color variables that stay linked to your base palette.

•🌗 Light & Dark Theme Support

Effortlessly manage color values for both light and dark modes.

•🧰 Visual Color Editor

Tweak colors visually with a real-time preview — no guesswork required.

•📁 Clean, Organized Structure

Keeps your color variables tidy and consistent with logical naming and folders.

•🧩 Built for Design Tokens

Prism follows a token-based approach inspired by the Lumos Design System, making it easy to plug into any design system workflow.


⸻


Prism helps you focus on what matters — great design — by handling the complexity of color systems behind the scenes. Perfect for design systems, large projects, or anyone who wants a more organized Figma file.
plugins.tagline: Color token management designed to power the Lumos Design System.

plugins.name: ShadeSmith – AI Palette Generator
plugins.description:
ShadeSmith is a Figma plugin that helps designers and developers instantly create scalable color palettes from a single base color (500-level).

It automatically generates tints, shades, and tonal variations using intelligent color logic. Whether you’re working on a design system, branding kit, or just experimenting, ShadeSmith ensures visually consistent and WCAG-compliant palettes with every click.


✨ Features:

•Start from any hex/RGB/base color

•Instantly generate tints (100–400) and shades (600–900)

•Accessible contrast suggestions built-in

•Copy-ready output for Figma styles, Tailwind tokens, or CSS

•Customizable intensity and range sliders


Perfect for:

•Design systems

•Theming

•Light/dark mode variants

•Rapid prototyping

accepted.name: Chandu Thota
accepted.description: I am a design leader with demonstrated expertise and experience of leading and delivering new product innovation, forming strategic design directions.

plugins.tagline: Generate full-color palettes in one click.

plugins.name: Change Variable Descriptions
plugins.description:
Tired of manually updating each Figma variable’s description? This plugin streamlines the process by allowing you to update all variable descriptions simultaneously using a CSV file. This means you can ensure your design system stays consistent and well-documented—without the hassle of repetitive edits.


How It Works:


•Prepare Your CSV: Create a CSV file with the format: token_name,description. Ensure each variable name in your CSV matches exactly (1:1) with the ones in Figma; the plugin is sensitive to misspellings and will skip any mismatches.

•Select Variable Collection(s): Choose one or multiple variable collections based on your CSV file. (Recommendation: create a separate CSV for each collection.)

•Preview Changes: Review the highlighted changes in a table before applying them, ensuring accuracy and control over the update process.

•Apply Updates: With just a few clicks, update all selected variable descriptions in your Figma design system.


Streamline your design documentation, avoid manual errors, and keep your design tokens up-to-date effortlessly!
plugins.tagline: Simplify workflow: Update variable descriptions in one click

plugins.name: Protoboi
plugins.description:
From the makers of 'Prototype This!'... comes Protoboi.


Protoboi is a tool to save you time prototyping. It helps you perfect your interactions (bezier easing curves, durations etc.) quickly by treating them in a componentized way.


Here's how the workflow works-


1) Use our other plugin 'Prototype This!' to wire up your prototype fast.

2) Make an interaction in Figma, and get all the animation properties just how you want it.

3) Open Protoboi & bulk-apply these animation parts, like custom bezier easing curves.


It's in beta, but mostly works. Feedback appreciated (comments or drop messages on livechat). :-)
plugins.tagline: Make prototypes fast w/ Protoboi! Bulk-apply animation properties to your interactions in seconds.

plugins.name: Lint copy
plugins.description:
Lint copy helps UX writers and content designers automatically enforce style rules with a custom word list.


Enforce things like plain language (e.g. detect "utilize" and suggest replacing it with "use"), the company's voice and tone (e.g. detect "we are" and suggest using the contraction), and even product terminology.


Create a custom word list in JSON and host it in a public GitHub repository to experience the plugin's full power.


The plugin also enforces sentence case and strings starting with a capital, neither of which is customizable.


For full details, read the documentation.
plugins.tagline: Check text layers against a word list to enforce style, voice, and terminology.

For full details, read the documentation.
103128.tagline: Check text layers against a word list to enforce style, voice, and terminology.

plugins.name: Fijira ( Jira Integration )
plugins.description:
Streamline your workflow and eliminate the gap between design and project management with Fijira. This powerful plugin seamlessly connects your Figma designs directly to your Jira tickets, ensuring that your development team always has access to the latest frames, feedback, and design specifications.


Stop wasting time manually exporting assets and pasting links. With Fijira, you can create detailed Jira comments, update ticket statuses, and link specific Figma frames directly from within your design file.


Key Features:


One-Click Jira Comments: Create rich, formatted comments in Jira tickets directly from Figma.

Automatic Frame Linking: Automatically attach a link to your selected Figma frame. If no frame is selected, you have the option to paste a link manually.

Status Updates: View available transitions and update the status of your Jira tickets without leaving Figma.

Simple Markdown Editor: Format your comments with bold, italics, lists, and links to keep your communication clear and organized.

Secure & Private: Your Jira credentials are saved securely in your local Figma storage and are never exposed. All communication happens through a secure, private proxy server.

Easy Setup: A simple, one-time setup for your Jira domain, email, and API token gets you started in minutes.

How to Use:


Run the Plugin: Open Fijira from the plugins menu.

Enter Your Settings: In the settings view, enter your Jira domain (e.g., your-company.atlassian.net), your Jira account email, and a valid Jira API token.

Select a Frame (Optional): Select a single frame in your Figma file that you want to link.

Fill in Commit Details: In the commit view, enter a commit title, a detailed description (using the markdown editor!), and the target Jira issue key (e.g., PROJ-123).

Update Status (Optional): Choose a new status for your Jira ticket from the dropdown menu.

Commit! Click "Commit & Update Jira". Fijira will post your comment, link, and status change to the specified Jira ticket and create a new version in your Figma file history.

Say goodbye to context switching and hello to a more efficient workflow with Fijira!

accepted.name: 0mid madah
accepted.description: Product Designer by trade, problem-solver by nature. I build bridges between human needs and digital solutions, one pixel at a time.

plugins.tagline: Sync your Figma designs with Jira issue, seamlessly.

plugins.name: FigJsonizer
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you select any frame or component in Figma and instantly convert it into a clean, structured JSON object. It's perfect for devs building UI components, syncing data with code, or generating design specs.


No network needed, no fluff—just fast, reliable JSON export from your Figma canvas. Copy the data to clipboard and use it wherever your workflow takes you: React, Angular, JSON-based APIs—you name it.


Ideal for design-to-dev handoff, prototyping, and frontend engineering.
plugins.tagline: Generate and copy clean JSON from selected Figma frames.

133815.description:

133815.tagline: Generate and copy clean JSON from selected Figma frames.

plugins.name: Pseudo Localizer for Figma & FigJam
plugins.description:
Design global-ready UIs—without ever leaving Figma.


Skip the guesswork and see how your designs hold up in other languages, scripts, and text directions—instantly. With Pseudo Localizer, you can preview localized versions of your UI in seconds, directly inside Figma or FigJam. No setup, no logins, no external tools. Just you and your design.


ℹ️ What you can do with Pseudo Localizer:


✅ Preview global scripts instantly

Toggle between Latin, Cyrillic, CJK, and Arabic (RTL) with a single click.


✅ Test layout resilience

Stretch or shrink text length from –50% to +50% to spot issues like clipping, wrapping, or misalignment.


✅ Control the scope

Run it on a single button, a card, or the whole page—your call.


✅ Keep it private & fast

Everything happens on your machine. No accounts, no external servers, no privacy worries.


❗️Why it matters:


  1. Catch layout issues before they become bugs.
  2. Give your QA and localization teams better previews.
  3. Design smarter for a global audience—right from the start.


⚙️ How it works:


  1. Select your screens with text layers (or don't select anything to pseudo translate the full page).
  2. Pick your script and text expansion.
  3. Click "Pseudotranslate"—done! A new page appears with your mocked-up, localized content (including RTL adjustments).


✨ Ready to build for every language?

Install Pseudo Localizer from the Figma Community and see how your designs hold up across the globe.


📨 Got feedback? Share it here!

accepted.name: José Jóvena Casañ
accepted.description:
Helping teams make great design work everywhere.
Big on UX, localization, and making things clear across cultures.
Rookie Figma Plugin Author.

plugins.tagline: Instantly pseudotranslate your Figma designs to test global layouts—no setup, no accounts.

plugins.name: TokenTidy
plugins.description: TokenTidy helps you quickly find frames, layers, and text in your Figma files that are missing design tokens. Scan selected frames and get a clean, organized report of elements missing fills, strokes, or typography styles. Perfect for teams standardizing their design systems or tidying up messy files. Save time, stay consistent, and ship polished designs with ease.
plugins.tagline: Spot unstyled elements instantly.

Save time, stay consistent, and ship polished designs with ease.
131180.release_notes:
TokenTidy v1.0.2 – UI & Accessibility Polish

What’s new:
Success message now features a clear checkmark-in-circle icon in accessible green for better clarity and contrast.
All icons are larger and spacing is more visually balanced for a friendlier, more readable experience.
Improved padding and spacing in all feedback messages.
Warning and success messages are visually distinct and easy to understand.
All icons and colors pass accessibility contrast checks.
General UI polish and minor bug fixes.

Thank you for using TokenTidy! If you have feedback or suggestions, let us know.

plugins.name: QR Code Generator
plugins.description:
Generate QR codes without leaving Figma. Customize with your own link, logo and colors.


This plugin creates static QR codes in SVG format, so they can be resized without losing quality. It uses RecodeQR to generate the image (no account needed). The QR codes are fully self-contained: they don’t rely on our service and they’re yours forever.


Tip: To scan QR codes you can use the camera app on iOS, or you can also inspect them online.
plugins.tagline: Create QR codes without leaving Figma

126163.name: QR Code Generator
126163.description:
Generate QR codes without leaving Figma. Customize with your own link, logo and colors.


This plugin creates static QR codes in SVG format, so they can be resized without losing quality. It uses RecodeQR to generate the image (no account needed). The QR codes are fully self-contained: they don’t rely on our service and they’re yours forever.


Tip: To scan QR codes you can use the camera app on iOS, or you can also inspect them online.

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin requires network access to RecodeQR's API to generate QR codes. No user data is stored.

126163.release_notes: Fixed dark mode, improve community details
126163.tagline: Create QR codes without leaving Figma

plugins.name: i18n JSON exporter
plugins.description:
Escape the time-consuming manual localization work and costly third-party tools with their cumbersome plugins. Leverage the power of Figma variables for efficient i18n.


Simply use your Design System or a central library file to create i18n keys, and then effortlessly export them for development with this plugin.


Step 1

Setup your Figma variables. Create a collection, add a columns (modes) for each language you wish to localize.


Not a step

Use those variables to replace your labels, input placeholders and more. Then use the "Appearance > Apply variable mode" to switch between languages (modes). I suggest having an "ID" mode with the i18n keys, like $general.table.label_lastModified.


Step 2

Run this plugin, select a collection and modes desired, then click "Export JSON file".


Note

This plugin uses the variable group path to create a hierarchical structure in the exported JSON. For example, a variable named general / table / label_lastModified would be exported as:


{
"general": {
"table": {
"label_lastModified": "Last modified"
}
}
}


Future features

Leave comments to vote on the following features I planned and what features you would like to see on this plugin.

  1. Github Merge Request integration
  2. Support to different JSON formats
  3. Transformation capabilities
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly export your Figma i18n variables to a React-compatible JSON format

plugins.name: Magnetic Snap
plugins.description:
You can align multiple selected objects horizontally or vertically with no gaps (0px spacing).


When aligning horizontally, objects are placed from left to right, and when aligning vertically, objects are placed from top to bottom. Setting a keyboard shortcut allows you to align objects more quickly than setting 0 pixels of space in Auto Layout.


選択した複数オブジェクトを水平方向または垂直方向に、隙間なく(間隔0pxで)揃えることができます。


水平揃えの場合、オブジェクトは左から右に配置され、垂直揃えの場合、上から下に配置されます。キーボードショートカットを設定すると、Auto Layoutで0ピクセルのスペースを設定するよりも素早く揃えることができます。
plugins.tagline: Align objects with zero spacing

plugins.name: Asset Dependencies
plugins.description:
Effortlessly manage and visualize your Figma assets with the Asset Dependencies plugin. This powerful tool scans and analyzes your local Figma files, creating a topologically sorted list of all components, subcomponents, dependencies, and usage.


Comprehensive analysis

Automatically scans your Figma assets to identify all components and their relationships.


Topological sorting

Generates a clear, topologically sorted list of components and subcomponents, making it easy to understand dependencies.


Dependency mapping

Visualize which components are used by others, helping you manage and optimize your design system.


Usage insights

See at a glance how and where each component is used across your file.


Export options

Export lists as CSV files to use in other tools.

accepted.name: Elgato
accepted.description: Stream. Record. Create. | Empowering content creators since 2012

plugins.name: Create Red Rectangle Plugin
plugins.description:
Objective: Implement functionality where clicking a button creates a red rectangle on the workspace.


Implementation Plan:


Creating the Interface:


Add a button labeled "Create Rectangle."

Prepare a canvas or container where the rectangle will appear.

Styling Elements:


Define styles for the button (e.g., color, shape).

Set default dimensions and properties for the rectangle (e.g., width, height, background color).

Programming Logic:


Write an event handler for the button: on click, create an element with predefined properties (e.g., width, height, color).

Append this element to the container on the page.

Testing the Functionality:


Ensure the red rectangle appears correctly and only when the button is clicked.

Optionally, add features such as slightly offsetting the position of each new rectangle.
plugins.tagline: Rectangle

110619.name: Create Red Rectangle Plugin
110619.description:

Testing the Functionality:

plugins.name: Section Generator
plugins.description:
Allows you to create a large number of sections all at once. This is a great way to organize a handoff file with each row for different functionality or features.


Main section

Each main section is a row with a cover tile. The cover tile will be titled with the name you give. Main sections are stacked vertically.


Subsections

Configure the number of subsections you want per row. Subsections are spaced horizontally.


-> Allows you to include any number of desktop (1440) and mobile (390) screens

-> Each screen has a notes field below it for your annotations
plugins.tagline: Create sections of sections for an organized design handoff

108541.description:

plugins.name: FigmaLint
plugins.description:
FigmaLint is an AI-powered design analysis tool that helps designers and developers create more consistent, accessible, and production-ready components.


Key Features:

  1. 🔍 Component Analysis - Get instant insights into component structure, properties, states, and design token usage
  2. 💬 AI Chat Assistant - Ask questions about design systems, best practices, and get contextual help
  3. 🎯 MCP Integration - Enhanced analysis with design systems knowledge for better recommendations
  4. 🏆 Audit Scoring - Comprehensive scoring for accessibility, consistency, and code-readiness
  5. 🎨 Token Analysis - Identify hard-coded values and get semantic token recommendations
  6. 📋 Property Documentation - Auto-generate property sheets and developer handoff documentation


Perfect for:

  1. Design system teams building scalable component libraries
  2. Developers who need clear component specifications
  3. Designers wanting to improve component quality and consistency
  4. Teams looking to streamline design-to-code handoff


How it works:

  1. Select any component in your Figma file
  2. Click "Analyze" to get instant insights
  3. Review recommendations for improvements
  4. Use the AI chat for specific questions
  5. Export documentation for developers


FigmaLint uses Claude AI to provide intelligent analysis and the MCP (Model Context Protocol) server for design systems best practices, ensuring your components are production-ready and follow industry standards.

accepted.name: TJ Pitre
accepted.description: Connecting the dots between design systems, AI, and the product development lifecycle.

plugins.tagline: AI-powered component analysis and design systems chat for Figma

plugins.name: ExportEase
plugins.description:
Transform your Figma design tokens into clean, organized code files that developers will love.

ExportEase bridges the gap between design and development by intelligently exporting your Figma variables and styles to 6 professional formats: CSS, SCSS, JavaScript, JSON, Dart, and Tailwind CSS.

🎯 Why ExportEase?

Smart Organization: Automatically creates separate files for each collection and mode (perfect for light/dark themes). No more messy, mixed token files.

Professional Output: Advanced sorting algorithm handles complex naming patterns - from simple numbering to semantic scales (xs, sm, md, lg, xl).

Developer-Ready: Generates production-quality code with proper formatting, comments, and import instructions. Variables are correctly formatted with fallbacks and references.

Effortless Workflow: One-click exports with ZIP downloads containing organized files and a helpful README with import instructions.

Multiple Formats for Every Stack:

CSS Custom Properties for modern web

SCSS Variables for preprocessing workflows

JavaScript ES6 modules with TypeScript support

JSON for any platform or documentation

Dart constants for Flutter development

Tailwind CSS config extensions ready to use

Perfect for:

✨ Design systems teams maintaining consistent tokens

✨ Developers who need clean, organized design token files

✨ Projects with multiple themes or brands

✨ Teams working across web, mobile, and Flutter platforms

The Result: Instead of manually copying variables or getting messy exports, you get perfectly organized, developer-friendly files that respect your Figma structure and naming conventions.

Export once, use everywhere. Your design tokens, exactly how your developers want them.
plugins.tagline: Transform design tokens into developer-ready code

139997.name: ExportEase
139997.description:
Transform your Figma design tokens into clean, organized code files that developers will love.

ExportEase bridges the gap between design and development by intelligently exporting your Figma variables and styles to 6 professional formats: CSS, SCSS, JavaScript, JSON, Dart, and Tailwind CSS.

🎯 Why ExportEase?

Smart Organization: Automatically creates separate files for each collection and mode (perfect for light/dark themes). No more messy, mixed token files.

Professional Output: Advanced sorting algorithm handles complex naming patterns - from simple numbering to semantic scales (xs, sm, md, lg, xl).

Developer-Ready: Generates production-quality code with proper formatting, comments, and import instructions. Variables are correctly formatted with fallbacks and references.

CSS Custom Properties for modern web

SCSS Variables for preprocessing workflows

Perfect for:

✨ Developers who need clean, organized design token files

✨ Teams working across web, mobile, and Flutter platforms

The Result: Instead of manually copying variables or getting messy exports, you get perfectly organized, developer-friendly files that respect your Figma structure and naming conventions.

Export once, use everywhere. Your design tokens, exactly how your developers want them.
139997.release_notes:
# 🚀 ExportEase - Advanced Design Token Exporter

## Transform Your Figma Variables into Production-Ready Code

**ExportEase** is the most comprehensive design token export plugin for Figma, enabling seamless integration between design and development workflows. Export your Figma variables and styles to multiple code formats with just a few clicks.

---

## ✨ **What's New in This Update**

### 🎯 **Direct Download Feature**
- **Skip the preview, get your files instantly!** New direct download option bypasses the preview step
- Click "Download Selected Files" and get your tokens immediately as individual files or ZIP archives
- Perfect for CI/CD workflows and rapid prototyping

### 🔧 **Enhanced Export Experience**
- **Smart file organization** - automatically groups exports by collections and modes
- **Comprehensive error handling** with detailed debugging information
- **Improved state management** - no more stuck buttons or broken workflows
- **Better performance** with optimized token collection and analysis

---

## 🎨 **Core Features**

### **📦 Multiple Export Formats**
- **CSS Custom Properties** - Perfect for modern web applications
- **Tailwind Config** - Ready-to-use Tailwind CSS theme configuration
- **JavaScript/TypeScript** - Import tokens directly into your JS/TS projects

### **🎛️ Flexible Export Options**
- **Variables Export** - Convert Figma variables (colors, spacing, typography, etc.)
- **Styles Export** - Export paint styles, text styles, and effect styles
- **Selective Export** - Choose exactly which files and collections you need
- **Batch Export** - Export all collections and modes in one ZIP file

### **🏗️ Smart Organization**
- **Collection-based grouping** - Each variable collection becomes a separate file
- **Mode support** - Light/dark themes, responsive breakpoints, brand variations
- **Intelligent naming** - Converts Figma names to valid CSS/JS variable names
- **Conflict resolution** - Handles duplicate names and edge cases gracefully

---

## 🛠️ **Perfect For**

### **👩‍💻 Developers**
- Eliminate manual token copying and reduce errors
- Get production-ready code that integrates seamlessly
- Support for modern frameworks (React, Vue, Angular, etc.)
- Compatible with design system tools and component libraries

### **🎨 Designers**
- Maintain design-development consistency automatically
- Share design decisions as usable code
- Streamline handoff process with developers
- Support complex design systems with multiple themes

### **🏢 Teams**
- Establish single source of truth for design tokens
- Scale design systems across multiple products
- Reduce design-development friction and iteration time
- Enable design system governance and consistency

---

## 🚀 **How It Works**

1. **📊 Analyze** - Plugin automatically detects your variables and styles
2. **🎯 Select** - Choose your export format (CSS, Tailwind, or JS)
3. **📁 Pick Files** - Select which collections and modes to export
4. **⬇️ Download** - Get your files instantly or preview before download

---

## 💡 **Use Cases**

### **🌙 Theme Systems**
Export light/dark mode variables as separate CSS files or combined Tailwind config

### **📱 Responsive Design**
Convert breakpoint-specific spacing and typography scales to code

### **🎨 Brand Systems**
Export brand-specific color palettes and typography for multi-brand applications

### **🧩 Component Libraries**
Generate design tokens for React, Vue, or Angular component libraries

### **📖 Documentation**
Create token documentation and style guides automatically

---

## 🔧 **Technical Specifications**

- **🔗 Zero Dependencies** - Works entirely within Figma, no external services
- **📦 Multiple Output Formats** - CSS, JavaScript, Tailwind CSS
- **🗂️ Smart File Organization** - Collection and mode-based structure
- **🛡️ Error Handling** - Comprehensive validation and user-friendly error messages
- **⚡ Performance Optimized** - Handles large design systems efficiently
- **🔄 Backward Compatible** - Works with existing Figma variable structures

---

## 🎯 **Keywords**
Design Tokens, CSS Variables, Tailwind CSS, Design System, Variables Export, Styles Export, Design-to-Code, Developer Tools, Design Handoff, Theme Export, Color Palette, Typography Scale, Spacing System

---

## 📞 **Support & Feedback**

Found a bug or have a feature request? We'd love to hear from you!
- **GitHub**: [Report Issues & Contribute](https://github.com/yourrepo/exportease)
- **Contact**: [sepantapouya.com](https://sepantapouya.com)

---

*Transform your design workflow today - consistent tokens, faster development, better products.* 🚀
139997.tagline: Transform design tokens into developer-ready code
